title: Ticket #6302: file transfer of directories windows to linux directory delimiter bug
description:
From htcondor-users:

  I am currently running into an issue trying to transfer output from a Windows (2012R2) Exec back to a Linux (SLES11SP3) schedd. The job creates a directory named results in the condor execute directory and writes output there. Then based on the submit file Condor tries to copy the results directory back to the schedd. However it looks like it gets confused about the file name and ends up creating a file called results\output.h5 on the schedd instead of putting output.h5 into the results directory.

The full description on htcondor-users is available here.

This appears to be a case of HTCondor not properly understanding the directory delimiter (backwards vs forwards slash) when transferring the contents of directories, and requires a code patch to fix. In the meantime, there is a work-around available to the end user by leveraging transfer_output_remaps in the job submit file. For instance, to workaround the problem described above the user could put 

   transfer_output_remaps = "results\\output.h5=results/output.h5"

in their submit file.
